meanings.definition: To remove or reduce sexual characteristics or associations.
meanings.sent1: The artist decided to desexualize the painting by covering up the revealing parts.
meanings.sent2: The company's goal was to desexualize their advertisements to appeal to a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that the new dress code would desexualize the office and lead to more productivity.
meanings.sent4: The educational program aimed to desexualize the topic of human anatomy for younger students.
meanings.sent5: The counselor used art therapy to desexualize the trauma experienced by the survivor.

meanings.definition: To make something less sexual in nature.
meanings.sent1: The school implemented policies to desexualize the dress code and promote a more professional environment.
meanings.sent2: The movie director decided to desexualize the romantic scenes to make the film suitable for all ages.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer's new collection aimed to desexualize the concept of lingerie and focus on comfort.
meanings.sent4: The social media platform introduced new guidelines to desexualize content and ensure a safe environment for users.
meanings.sent5: The therapist helped the patient desexualize their thoughts and emotions to address underlying issues.
